item.title: Tracy add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The difference between the right word and the almost right word is the difference between lightning and a lightning bug." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "There is a thin line that separates laughter and pain, comedy and tragedy, humor and hurt." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Enrique Jardiel Poncela
item.description: "When something can be read without effort, great effort has gone into its writing." -- Enrique Jardiel Poncela

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "Writing is utter solitude, the descent into the cold abyss of oneself." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Colette
item.description:
"Put down everything that comes into your head and then you're a writer. But an author is one who can judge his own stuff's worth, without pity, and destroy most of it."
(<i>Casual Chance</i>, 1964)" -- Colette

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Hart Crane
item.description: "One must be drenched in words, literally soaked in them, to have the right ones form themselves into the proper pattern at the right moment." -- Hart Crane

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Erma Bombeck
item.description: "When humor goes, there goes civilization." -- Erma Bombeck

item.title: Tracy add a quote by G.K. Chesterton
item.description: "A good novel tells us the truth about its hero; but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author." -- G.K. Chesterton

item.title: Tracy add a quote by William Makepeace Thackeray
item.description: "There are a thousand thoughts lying within a man that he does not know till he takes up the pen to write." -- William Makepeace Thackeray

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Samuel Johnson
item.description: "I never desire to converse with a man who has written more than he has read." -- Samuel Johnson

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Never confuse movement with action." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Isaac Bashevis Singer
item.description: "The wastepaper basket is the writer’s best friend. " -- Isaac Bashevis Singer

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "A story is a way to say something that can’t be said any other way, and it takes every word in the story to say what the meaning is." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Tracy add a quote by John Ruskin
item.description: "Say all you have to say in the fewest possible words, or your reader will be sure to skip them; and in the plainest possible words or he will certainly misunderstand them." -- John Ruskin
